Name: Chynal Lindsey
Description:
Chynal's body was found after someone called the police to report a body in White Rock Lake. Police reported that her body showed “obvious signs of homicidal violence”.

> A second black transgender woman was found dead over the weekend in Dallas. This past Saturday, police found the body of Chynal Lindsey, 26, in White Rock Lake after someone called police to report a body in the lake.
> 
> At a press conferences, Police Chief U. Reneé Hall said Lindsey’s body had “obvious signs of homicidal violence.”
> 
> Hall said that Dallas Police have reached out to the FBI to help with the investigation because of a possible connection to another trans woman who was murdered in the Dallas area.
> 
> “We are concerned, and we are actively and aggressively investigating the case,” Hall said.
> 
> Last month, [Muhlaysia Booker](https://tdor.translivesmatter.info/reports/2019/05/18/muhlaysia-booker_dallas-texas-usa_9198acdd) was found shot to death in Dallas. A month prior to being murdered, she was beaten by a mob that shouted anti-LGBTQ epithets like “That’s what your faggot ass gets” and “Get that faggot out of our hood.”

In August 2019 Rubén Alvarado, 22, was charged with her murder.

> A grand jury in Dallas County charged a young Hispanic man with the murder of a transgender woman found dead at White Rock Lake in Dallas on June 1.
>
> Chynal Lindsey, a 26-year-old African-American woman, died of an obvious violent homicide, police said.
>
> Rubén Alvarado, 22, remains in the Dallas County jail on $ 500,000 bail and investigators say he refuses to cooperate with the investigation.
>
> However, a murder charge filed today reveals more details about Lindsey's death, specifically that investigators believe Alvarado drowned and hit Lindsey with his hands, a belt and other object that caused blunt trauma to the woman's body. .
>
> The accusation did not include any information about the reason for the attack, but police said Alvarado's phone contained GPS data that showed the device in the exact place where Lindsey's body was recovered.

In November 2021 Alvarado was convicted and sentenced to 32 years in prison for Chynal's murder.

Chynal's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/chynal.lindsey.52.

Name: Johana Medina León ("Joa")
Description:
Joa was a detained Salvadorian asylum seeker. She had been asking for medical help for nearly 2 months, but ICE only took her to hospital after she lost consciousness.

<sup><sub>* ICE is Immigration Customs Enforcement, a US federal agency [known to mistreat detained asylum seekers](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/immigration/22-immigrants-died-ice-detention-centers-during-past-2-years-n954781).</sub></small>

Grecia, a trans activist from Casa Migrante in Juarez, Mexico who accompanied Joa until the end said the following:

> "Her name was Johana Medina, known to her friends as Joa. She was in ICE detention for two months in a New Mexico facility. For weeks she pleaded for medical help, referring to health problems caused by complications with HIV/AIDS.
> 
> After two months of suffering, Joana became extremely ill and unconscious forcing ICE to take her to Las Palmas del Sol Hospital in El Paso, Texas. This morning I went to visit her at the hospital intensive care unit. When I looked at her I said that what happened a year ago to [Roxana](https://tdor.translivesmatter.info/reports/2018/05/13/roxana-hernandez-rodriguez_milan-new-mexico-usa_76611862) in the month of May could happen to Joa right in there.
> 
> And it did. Unfortunately today at 21:00 hrs I got called by the hospital to tell me that she had passed away... ¨

[Diversidad Sin Fronteras](https://www.facebook.com/pg/diversidadsinfronteraz) issued the following statement:
> 
> “We regret to inform the community that ICE has taken one more of our sisters. Johana Medina aka Joa, a Salvadoran trans woman has died in ICE custody in a hospital of El Paso, Tx yesterday at 21:00.”
> 
> “We’re seen as people that aren’t part of society. Like we’re a disease. Inhuman.”
said the five trans asylum seekers interviewed by the San Antonio Express-News who are in or recently released from the Pearsall detention center.
> 
> Joa is the 23rd person overall and the second trans person to die while in ICE custody according to an NBC report dated Jan 6th 2019. Most like Roxana Hernández have died due to the Trump administration’s uncaring erratic detention policies. Adding insult to injury many and have suffered continuing inhumanities as the Government lies about and tries to hide their deaths.
> 
> We will update when more information becomes available.
> 
> Rest in Power Joa.

Later the same day a friend issued the following update:

> This the latest info I have gathered from family and friends regarding Joa's passing in ICE detention. Dates are approximate and they are gathered from phone convos:
> 
> Before April 11th: She had been waiting for her number #7326 to come up for her to present legally to seek asylum. She waited nearly three months in Juarez.
> 
> April 11th: She presented to CBP in El Paso, Tx. According to testimonies from her boyfriend and other trans women present: "she was told she was not trans", that "she was a man." Unlike her other comrades, she was not paroled out but sent to Otero County Processing Center.
> 
> May 21st: She calls her boyfriend to El Salvador telling him that she is not feeling well. She tells him she misses him and that was the last time he spoke to her.
> 
> From April 11th to May 23rd or 24th: Her health deteriorated. In El Salvador she was a certified nurse so she knew she was unable to take medication orally and in repetitive occasions she told ICE officers she needed an (IV) solution, that she could do it herself but she just needed the medication.
> 
> May 23th-25th: ICE decides to take her to the hospital after she appears to be unconscious. According to family members, she was granted release on recognizance the day she was dropped off at the hospital.
> 
> June 1st: Her uncle and Grecia, a trans leader from Juarez are notified Joa has passed away in Las Palmas del Sol hospital at 9:05pm.
> 
> She was loved by all of her family including her grandma the main reason for her to travel thousands of miles to be detained in inhumane conditions. She was unable to practice her nursing profession as an open trans woman so her dream was to come to the US to get certified and make a living healing people.
> 
> We send condolences to her partner, family, and friends.

Subsequently it emerged that ICE had deliberately withheld even basic medical care.

> Medina León, who worked as a nurse in El Salvador, recognized that she needed IV fluids, but was denied. When she asked for water, sugar and salt so she could make her own IV, Ice also refused, the claim said. The treatment in Ice custody was so bad that Medina León, who was fleeing violence in her home country, requested to be deported so she could get medical attention, lawyers said. That request was also denied.
>
> “She came to the US because she thought it was a great country and that she would be safe there,” her 22-year-old sister, Gabriela León, said in an email to the Guardian, sent by her lawyer. “She did everything right but was treated as a criminal … She shouldn’t have died. She went to the US seeking protection and now she is coming home to us dead.”
> 
> Christopher Dolan, an attorney who filed the claim, added: “She was desperate, because the government would not provide her with assistance of any kind for her medical needs.”

Name: Mayte Castro Anay ("Pamela")
Description:
Mayte ("Pamela") and her friend Miranda ("Chiqui") were shot in the head after attending a football match. A witness reported seeing motorcycles leaving the scene.

Pamela and [Chiqui](https://tdor.translivesmatter.info/reports/2019/06/02/miranda-pilar-ruiz-chiqui_guayaquil-guayas-ecuador_bd5eb759) had been friends for several years. Both were buried on the same day.
 
 > "I found out that when they got to the soccer championship they had a fight with some men, who did not want my daughter and her friend to be in that place having fun," said Pamela's mother.
> 
> According to a source, when they were leaving on their motorcycle, four subjects on two other motorcycles began to follow them.
>
> "As they passed [El Empalme], their attackers intercepted them and shot them in the head," he said. "This was not about stealing their belongings because they were undisturbed when they found their bodies."
> 
> Mía Casandra Bustamante Martínez, a stylist from Guayaquil, said her friend Chiqui was charismatic, cheerful, and always willing to help the community.
>
> "The murder of these girls was not because of robbery, it was homophobic. A few days ago a girl from Durán was killed, we want this to stop!"

Pamela's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/maiteanay.castro.3.

https://www.eluniverso.com/noticias/2019/06/04/nota/7360359/policia-investiga-crimen-dos-trans-acribilladas

Pamela was 24. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Fabiola
Description:
Fabiola's body was found lying in a pool of blood.

> A [trans woman] was found dead in the sector of Santa Cruz Minas, municipality of Quimistán, department of Santa Bárbara, western Honduras.
> 
> The deceased was known as Fabiola, was between 28 and 30 years old and frequented several places, including the place where she died.
> 
> Fabiola's body was lying face down in a pool of blood, it is unknown if she died from a gun or a knife.

> The crimes against the LGBTI community also enlist another trans girl, murdered on Sunday, June 2, in the community of San Francisco de los Valle, San Marcos, Quimistán, Santa Bárbara, in the western zone. The 23-year-old victim was known as Fabiola.
>
> Fabiola was murdered with a knife by her assassins who stabbed her in the neck. The event occurred when he left a party, explained Presentes, Indyra Mendoza, Red Cattrachas.
>
> When they found her, Fabiola lay face down with her body bloodied. The police have not filed charges nor have they reported who the criminals were.

Fabiola's body was found lying in a pool of blood in Quimistán, Santa Bárbara (Honduras) on or shortly before 3 Jun 2019.

Name: Austin Smith
Description:
Austin died by suicide. His death was reported by his best friend.

> On June 4th I lost my best friend Austin Smith (transman), to suicide in Evansville Indiana right before his 20th birthday

Our thanks to his friend for sending us his photo and ensuring that he won't be forgotten.

Name: Chanel Scurlock
Description:
Chanel was found just after midnight by Robeson County Sheriff’s Office deputies who arrived after reports of gunfire in the area. She had been shot.

> A Black transgender woman was found murdered in North Carolina this past Wednesday.
> 
> Chanel Scurlock, 23, was found just after midnight when Robeson County Sheriff’s Office deputies arrived after receiving reports of gunfire in the area. She had been shot.
> 
> Police said that her car was missing at the time of her death but that it was found later in the day. They did not say where.
> 
> The police, local media, and Scurlock’s mother identified her as a gay man, misgendered her, shared pictures of her presenting as male, and deadnamed her in media reports. Robeson County Sheriff Burnis Wilkins went so far to refer to her as “Mr.” in a Facebook post.
> 
> Her Facebook account, though, uses “she” pronouns and the name “Chanel,” only has photos of her presenting as female, and her friends referred to her as a woman.
> 
> “You lived your life as you wanted,” Kandice Stigger, a friend of the victim, wrote on Facebook. “I’m proud of you for being unapologetically correct about your feelings and expectations of YOU.”

Name: Layleen Cubilette Polanco Xtravaganza
Description:
Layleen was found dead in a jail cell in the Rose M. Singer women's facility on Rikers Island on the afternoon of Friday 7th June.

> At this moment we don’t have much information on what happened to my sister. All we know is that she got into a fight and got locked up and sent to Rikers she was there for a month and was due to come home the 13th of this month. We were notified yesterday that she was found dead in her cell with not much information. We will make sure her story is heard after we find out what happened. Please helps us lay her to rest. This was a very unexpected death and a big loss to her family and friends. Anything helps, thank you in advance as you all k ow Layleen loved you all even those that didn’t like her very much. Thank you all 

Layleen had been incarcerated for a month on a misdemeanour charge, and was due to be released on 13th June. At the time of her death she was being held in solitary confinement.

> Polanco was in the Rose M. Singer center, the women’s jail on Rikers Island, in a specialized unit for transgender women, according to a Correction Department spokesperson.
> 
> She was being held on $500 bail for prostitution and lowest-level drug possession charges stemming from a 2017 arrest, records show.
> 
> Jail officials put Polanco in solitary as punishment for her part in a fight, sources said.
> 
> An undercover cop arrested Polanco in August 2017 for allegedly agreeing to engage in oral sex for money and having what police called a crack pipe in her pocket, according to the Manhattan District Attorney’s Office.

A vigil for her was held on Monday 10th June.

> On Monday, community will come together to demand justice for Layleen Polanco Xtravaganza who was found dead in her cell at Rose M Singer Center at Rikers last Friday evening. 
> 
> NYC’s Department of Corrections established a trans housing unit to reduce violence against transgender and gender non-conforming people at Rikers. But “better” incarceration is still incarceration, and trans people are deeply unsafe in this system.
> 
> This tragic loss of yet another member of the trans community comes just days after the start of Pride season. There is no Pride to be had while trans folks continue to face an epidemic of fatal violence 

Layleen was a member of the [House of Xtravaganza](https://www.facebook.com/HouseOfXtravaganza/), a preeminent group on the city’s ballroom scene.

> Fellow house member Jimmy Xtravaganza spoke to THE CITY about Polanco after a demonstration for her in Manhattan’s Foley Square on Monday night.
> 
> He remembered his five-foot-three, Dominican-born friend as “so spunky, so full of life.”
> 
> “And positive, always, never, ever, ever drama,” he said. “She was a hell of a time. A beautiful person, never really in conflicts.”
> 
> Melania Brown, Polanco’s sister, spoke to the crowd at Foley Square through tears. “They treated my sister like she was nothing for how she decided to be happy,” she said.

[**#LayleenPolanco**](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23LayleenPolanco&src=typd)

Name: Pamela
Description:
Pamela was shot in the back. CCTV footage shows her falling on the sidewalk.

> Images from surveillance cameras caught the moments following a [trans woman] being shot in the back, in downtown Maringá, northern Paraná.
>
> The crime happened at dawn on Saturday (8), at the intersection between Avenida Herval and Rua Joubert de Carvalho.

https://g1.globo.com/pr/norte-noroeste/noticia/2019/06/10/imagens-mostram-travesti-baleada-no-centro-de-maringa.ghtml
Tweet: Pamela was shot in the back in Maringá, Paraná (Brazil) on 8 Jun 2019. CCTV footage showed her falling on the sidewalk. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Shakira ("La Moy")
Description:
Shakira was stoned to death by a group of men. Her body lay in the street in full view of her frightened neighbours before the police finally removed it several hours later.

> In Honduras, where 68% of the population of 9 million lives in conditions of poverty and exclusion, getting out of heteronorm costs life. In the last week two trans girls and a lesbian were brutally murdered and organizations of sexual diversity denounce that they were hate crimes.
> 
> Shakira or ""La Moy"", as she was known, was a young trans woman, who was killed by stones between midnight on Saturday June 8 and early Sunday morning in the colony Oswaldo Lopez Arellano, municipality of Choloma, in the northern department of Cortés, one of the most violent areas of Honduras. At just 20 years old, Shakira was executed in the same neighborhood where she lived. Her body remained in the street for several hours before the frightened eyes of his neighbors, who called the police.
> 
> Witnesses said that the crime was committed by men who brutally threw stones at her until she was killed, said Rihanna Ferrera, of the Cozumel Trans organization.

http://agenciapresentes.org/2019/06/12/honduras-tres-crimenes-de-odio-contra-personas-lgbt-en-una-semana/
Tweet:
Shakira was stoned to death in the street in Choloma, Cortés (Honduras) on 8 Jun 2019.

She was 20. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Alex Milkovich
Description:
Alex's body was found on 10th June. He had disappeared on 1st June after going to visit someone he thought was a friend.

A murder suspect was arrested on 17th June.

> Pharmaceutical Academy student Alex Milkovich disappeared on June 1, having left for Nytva and stopped communicating with relatives. At birth, Alex’s biological sex is female, but a few years ago he changed his first and last name in his passport and was about to undergo a sex change operation. In another city, he went to a friend - now the latter is detained on suspicion of murdering him.
> 
> According to the source 59.RU, now there are investigative actions. Investigators reported that the suspect in the murder was arrested the day before, on 17 June. The body of Alex was found in Nytva on June 10th.

Alex was a Pharmaceutical Academy student and had transitioned two years earlier.

https://59.ru/text/criminal/66128764/

https://www.anews.com/p/112279895-v-nytve-nashli-telo-propavshej-studentki-transgendera-kristiny-aleksa/

https://v-kurse.ru/news/incidents/on_kogoto_pokryvaet_rodnye_letney_permyachki_mechtavshey_smenit__pol_ne_veryat_chto_ee_ubil_drug_8833857/

https://compromat.group/news/important/16064-v-permskom-krae-ubit-student-transgender.html

https://ren.tv/novosti/2019-06-18/kopila-dengi-na-operaciyu-permskuyu-studentku-transgendera-ubil-drug

https://www.perm.kp.ru/online/news/3510277/

https://v-kurse.ru/russia/news/incidents/v_prikam_e_desyat__dney_ishchut_propavshuyu_letnyuyu_devushku_s_prichudami_8833668/
Tweet:
Alex Milkovich's body was found in Nytva, Perm Krai (Russia) on 10 Jun 2019.

He had disappeared 9 days earlier after going to visit someone he thought of as a friend.

He was 19. #SayHisName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Zoe Spears
Description:
Zoe was found lying in the street (not far from where Ashanti Carmon had been murdered in March) by police responding to an emergency call. She died at the scene.

> A transgender woman was found Thursday just before midnight by Prince George’s County police who responded to a call in the 600 blocks of 59th Ave., in Fairmount Heights, Maryland.
>
> 23-year-old Zoe Spears died on the scene of multiple gunshot wounds according to police. Spears was murdered just blocks from where 27-year-old [Ashanti Carmon](https://tdor.translivesmatter.info/reports/2019/03/30/ashanti-carmon_fairmount-heights-maryland-usa_eff36a3c) had been murdered in March 2019.
>
> Major Brian Reilly with Prince George’s County police said in the police video below that they don’t believe there are connections between the two murders, but police said Spears and Carmon knew each other.
> 
> Friends say Spears told multiple people she had witnessed Carmon’s killing and feared for her life. Spears was trying to move from her apartment on Eastern Avenue because she was afraid, friends say.
>
> Zoe Spears had gotten off of the streets and was living independently. She was murdered close to where she lived.
>
> Ashanti Carmon resorted to survival sex work after becoming homeless. She was murdered just a mile away in an area that residents say has become known for prostitution.

In July 2019 Gerardo Thomas, 33, of Baltimore, was arrested in Cecil County and charged with first-degree murder.

https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/crime/baltimore-man-charged-in-dc-area-killing-of-transgender-woman/ar-AAEEKgR

https://www.pghlesbian.com/2019/06/zoe-spears-23-is-the-10th-black-trans-woman-murdered-in-the-us-in-2019/

https://planettransgender.com/zoe-spears-murdered-fairmount-heights-md/

https://www.nbcwashington.com/news/local/Prince-Georges-County-Police-Investigate-Death-of-Trans-Woman-511313332.html

https://www.washingtonblade.com/2019/06/14/second-transgender-woman-killed-in-fairmount-heights/

https://www.advocate.com/crime/2019/6/14/trans-woman-murdered-dc-suburb-second-year

http://www.fox5dc.com/news/local-news/prince-georges-county-police-investigating-2nd-homicide-of-trans-woman-in-fairmount-heights

https://wtop.com/prince-georges-county/2019/06/transgender-woman-killed-in-md-not-far-from-scene-of-similar-homicide/
Tweet:
Zoe was shot in Fairmount Heights, Maryland (USA) on 13 Jun 2019.

She was 23.  #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Jony Sosa Sanchez
Description:
Jony was found dead inside her room by a neighbour. Her hands and feet were tied and there was a pool of blood on the floor.

> Coatzintla, Ver.- This day a young [trans woman] was found inside her house. Her body had signs of beating and her hands and feet were tied. She was found by a neighbor who, while passing the victim's home, saw the door open and noticed that she had not been seen in several hours.
>
> Curious, they decided to enter to call her and discovered the fatal scene. The victim was identified as Jony SS and lived in a cuartería*  located in the Xico neighborhood, in the municipality of Coatzintla.

<small>* A residence, building or tenancy of small housing units that generally share a common bathroom and patio, often occupied by families with limited economic resources.</small>

She was 27. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Nahara Sereya
Description:
Nahara was shot in the early hours of Sunday 16th June.

> A [trans woman] was shot dead in the early hours of Sunday (16), in Horizonte, Metropolitan Region of Fortaleza.
> 
> According to police, the victim, identified only as Nahara, 43, was shot by gunfire in the town of Queimadas, a rural area of ​​the municipality.
>
> The Civil Police of the State of Ceará has initiated an investigation to identify and arrest the perpetrator. The investigations of the homicide are in charge of the Metropolitan Police Station of Horizonte.

Nahara's Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/nahara.sereya.

Name: Defne Yilmaz
Description:
Defne was found dead in her bathroom on 16th June. She had been stabbed in the body and neck.

Her killer was arrested the following day.

> Defne, a transgender woman living in Afyon, was found dead at her home by friends on 16 June. She had been stabbed in the body and throat by a man who came to her home at around 5 pm in the afternoon.
>
> Bihter Karal, a close friend of the activist who informed the public of her death via social media, reported that a foreign man who entered the building at 17.05 was seen on security cameras stealing the phone and computers of the transgender woman.
>
> According to the information provided by the trans activist on social media accounts, the murder suspect was arrested and arrested after confessing to his wife at 2:00 pm.

Name: Pollyane Weneck dos Reis
Source ref: tgeu/16-Jun-2019/Pollyane Weneck and tgeu/16-Jun-2019/Maycon Clebes dos Reis
Description:
Pollyane was found lying in the street bleeding from the left hand side of her chest. She died in hospital.

> A 22-year-old [trans woman] was found dead with several stab wounds to the body on Sunday night, 16, at around 9 pm. According to the Military Police (PM), the body of [deadname] (her social name is unknown) was lying on a public road bleeding heavily from the left side of the chest.
> 
> Witnesses in premises nearby reported hearing no noise or shouting, only finding the victim lying on the ground. A colleague who lived with her said that she had been away from home and, upon returning, found her friend drinking with four young people.
> 
> [deadname] had later taken a dress and gone out to a cousin's house. The colleague also said that a fish knife was missing from the kitchen.
> 
> The victim was taken to the Municipal Emergency, but did not survive.

*Editor's Note: Pollyane's social name was not reported by the press, but was confirmed by [ANTRA](https://antrabrasil.org/mapadosassassinatos/).*

http://v9vitoriosa.com.br/policia/travesti-e-encontrada-morta-a-facadas-em-coromandel/

Name: Lohane Silva de Lira ("Jasmine")
Description:
Lohane's half-naked body was found in a thicket on Rua José Alves Lins in the Novo Horizonte neighborhood. She had been stabbed and her body dragged into the street.

Her boyfriend Robson José da Silva is being sought in connection with the crime.

> The body of a young [trans woman] was found in a vacant lot, near the CAIC in the neighborhood of Palmares, in Palmares, in the southern part of the state, early this afternoon (17). The victim, known as Lohane, was found with few pieces of clothing.
> 
> The Military Police were in the place and verified the occurrence. The [trans woman] had stab marks on her body, especially on the chest and arm. According to the investigations, [deadname], 21, had occasional amorous relationships with the suspect, identified as Robson José da Silva, who is a fugitive.
> 
> According to investigators there were bloodstains at the fugitive's address, suggesting that Lohane was killed in the suspect's home after a fight between them.

Note that some news reports give her name was Jasmine.

http://bjsempre.com.br/2019/06/18/travesti-foi-morto-a-facadas-em-palmares-na-mata-sul-de-pernambuco/

Name: Gabriella Rice
Description:
Gabriella died by suicide.

> Gabriella Rice died by suicide on June 21, 2019 in Augusta, Maine. The stigma she faced as a trans woman contributed considerably to her depression and death. She is deeply loved and missed. 

Gabriella's death was not recorded on the TDoR 2019 memorial list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2019. This report was sourced via an email message from someone close to her.
Tweet: Gabriella Rice died by suicide in Augusta, Maine (USA) on 21 Jun 2019. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Rita
Description:
Rita died by suicide.

> In Moscow, a transgender girl died. Rita. This was reported to Vesti.kg by her close friends.
>
> According to them, she committed suicide by jumping from the 10th floor of the house. The tragedy occurred on Belomorskaya Street on June 23 this year.
>
> “She was from Jalal-Abad,” her friends say. - Rita has almost completed the sex change procedure. But lately has become addicted to drugs.
>
> Relatives of the deceased also reported that they are now doing everything necessary to deliver the body to their homeland.

Name: Lauren Marie Waters
Description:
Lauren died by Suicide. Reportedly social isolation was a major contribution to her suicide.

> CW: suicide
>
> Not all names are on the TDoR list.
>
> Her name is Lauren Waters. She lived in Southampton, UK, and died on the 24th June 2019. Social isolation from being a trans woman was a major contribution to her suicide. Her name needs to be remembered too. 

Lauren's death was not recorded on the TDoR 2019 memorial list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2019. An inquest into her death was due to be held in Winchester Coroners Court on 19th November 2019.

Her Facebook profile is https://www.facebook.com/Yenneffa. 

https://twitter.com/HTBug/status/1197017015950684161

Lauren Marie Waters died by suicide in Southampton, Hampshire (United Kingdom) on 24 Jun 2019.

She was 27. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Brooklyn Lindsey
Description:
Brooklyn's body was found on the porch of an abandoned home.

> Police are investigating the death of a transgender woman whose body was found at an abandoned home.
> 
> Police say 32-year-old Brooklyn Lindsey was found dead shortly after 6:30 a.m. Tuesday at Independence and Spruce Avenues.
> 
> Police Sgt. Adam Painter says her body was found on the porch of the home. Lindsey showed obvious signs of trauma, but the cause of death was not immediately clear.
> 
> A lot of people in the neighborhood said they've been frustrated by problems with drugs, prostitution and violence on their street. They said Lindsey had been badly beaten before they heard the gunshots.

In July 2019 Marcus Lewis, 41, was charged with her murder.

> KANSAS CITY, Mo. — A Kansas City, Missouri, man was charged Friday in connection with the deadly shooting of a transgender woman last month, according to court records.
>
> Marcus Lewis, 41, was charged in Jackson County Court with second-degree murder, armed criminal action and unlawful possession of a firearm.
>
> According to court documents, Lewis shot 32-year-old Brooklyn Lindsey on June 25 as the two fought outside a house in the 600 block of Spruce Avenue.
>
> Lindsey, whom neighbors said was a transgender woman, was found on the front porch of the home. Police said her cause of death wasn’t immediately known.
>
> DNA on shell casings at the scene led detectives to Lewis, according to court documents.

On 12th August 2021 Lewis was sentenced to 22 years in prison for her murder.

> Kansas City MO. – A KC Man was sentenced to prison Thursday for the murder of Missouri Transgender woman Brooklyn Lindsey.
>
> Marcus S. Lewis, 43, was sentenced Thursday to 22 years in a Missouri prison for the 2019 murder of Brooklyn Lindsey, a homeless transgender woman.
>
> Lewis had pleaded guilty on June 24 to voluntary manslaughter in the killing of 32-year-old Brooklyn Lindsey. Lewis also pleaded guilty to armed criminal action and unlawful possession of a weapon.

Name: J. P. Moreno
Description:
J. was shot dead in a supermarket parking lot.

> Coatzacoalcos, Veracruz.- A transsexual woman was shot dead on Tuesday in the parking lot of Bodega Aurrera around 7:50 p.m., Palmas branch, located on Avenida Universidad Veracruzana.

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was one of two transgender women who were tortured and beaten to death. Their bodies were recovered by police from a locked house.

> MULTAN, Pakistan (AP) — Police in Pakistan say they have found the bodies of two transgender women who were tortured and beaten to death.
>
> Senior officer Mohammad Ali Zia says the bodies were recovered late Saturday from a locked house in the Sahiwal district of the eastern Punjab province. He says it’s unclear what motivated the killings, which appear to have taken place three days ago.
>
> Transgender people are often subjected to abuse in conservative, Muslim-majority Pakistan. They are also among the victims of so-called honor killings carried out by relatives to punish perceived sexual transgressions.

https://apnews.com/79f866a3ff304fae9344c9bdfe8cfc1c
Tweet: An unidentified #trans woman was one of two tortured and beaten to death in Multan, Punjab (Pakistan) on 28 Jun 2019. #SayTheirNames #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Maya
Description:
Maya was murdered by her father after going to the police to ask for protection.

> NOWSHERA: A transgender person ‘Maya’ has been allegedly murdered by her father and thrown her dead body near Kabul River in Khat Qila area of Nowshera, police sources said on Sunday.
>
> Police arrested the father of the 19-year old transgender person ‘Maya’ and started investigation into the case. They say the transgender person was shot dead.
> According to details, Maya’s father along with other accomplices opened fire and killed her on the spot. Police took her body to the hospital for a postmortem.
> Meanwhile, the transgender community has announced it will stage a protest in Peshawar against Maya’s murder. They alleged that Maya’s father has a problem with her being transgender.

According to Pakistani news outlet Samaa TV her father has been arrested but police are still searching for her uncle and brothers.
